item.title: Brazil
item.description: I recently watched 12 monkeys, which had scenes with some pretty cool futuristic steampunk props, which I really liked. This made me look up into the other work of the director, that’s where I saw Brazil.

item.title: Song Exploder the Cranberries
item.description: I’ve already mentioned Song Exploder – a nice podcast where songs are “exploded” in parts, by the artists themselves. This week, I listened to their last album, which reminded me of one of the best episodes of Song Exploder – the one about “All Over Now” from that exact album.

item.title: Diablo 4 Beta
item.description: With nothing notable to share, and as I wait for the weather to fix itself, this week’s thing is the Diablo 4 beta.

item.title: Taxi Driver Soundtrack
item.description: A few weeks ago, I watched Martin Scorsese’s Taxi Driver. It is a bit of an atmospheric film with some dark spots here and there, but to me, it’s one of the best portrays of being lonely in a big city.

item.title: Ulysses
item.description: This week’s thing is my helper in writing these posts. The Ulysses app. Originally, I was an iA Writer user, but for some purposes it became a bit limited for me.

item.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
item.description: Pressing play on Mad Max: Fury Road yesterday I definitely didn’t expect such movie. I wanted to watch it because I saw it in some letterboxd lists about world building and aesthetic.

item.title: Truth About February
item.description: This week’s thing is this video about February. I always looked at it as the most boring winter month, but this video made me even hate it a bit.

item.title: Severance
item.description: I added Severance to my watch list the moment I saw the trailer. I had no doubt it will be good because the idea, at least for me, was unheard of.

item.title: Spotify Automix
item.description: This week I found about a Spotify feature that I didn’t know existed. I was listening to a Spotify made electronic playlist and started to notice that songs just don’t end.

item.title: Lisbon
item.description: Recently, I got back from my first trip outside the country for a vacation since late 2019. I was in Lisbon with friends for a week and it was pretty cool.

item.title: Disney Plus
item.description: I was reluctant to check Disney Plus when it became available because I thought it’s all Marvel, Star Wars, and animations, but I was wrong.

item.title: Malenia on Dance Pad and Controller
item.description: I’ve seen no hit runs and other challenges that people like to torture themselves with, but for the first time I saw someone playing the game not only in two parallel versions, but also with different controllers.

item.title: Letterboxd
item.description: I was never a movie buff. I rarely missed a good sci-fi, but I’ve always been more of a TV shows guy.

item.title: RimWorld
item.description: I have a soft heart for punishing games, so it’s no surprise that RimWorld was on my wish list for quite some time.

item.title: Retro Christmas Commercials
item.description: It’s the holidays. I usually have several Christmas lo-fi videos that I listen to for the mood, but this year I had a new idea – find retro Christmas commercials – and play them as a background to the music.

item.title: Neovim
item.description: I’ve been a VIM user for close to 6 years. I always used the regular one, though with a good number of plugins.

item.title: What Future
item.description: My thing of the week this time is a new podcast from Joshua Topolsky (Engadget, The Verge, and other cool places on the internet).

item.title: Philip K. Dick Electric Dreams
item.description: I’ve read two Philip K. Dick books, so knowing at least partially what to expect, I was excited when I saw that someone is about to make a TV show out of his stories.

item.title: Trey Kennedy Sketches
item.description: It’s a tradition to mention comedy YouTube channels I follow, so here’s another one – Trey Kennedy. He definitely has a unique niche in the comedy part of YouTube.

item.title: Neil Frances
item.description: This year, I have a new favourite dream pop band (at least that’s how I categorise them). I don’t know where I heard them, probably a Spotify radio recommendation, but I kept a song from them in my skating playlist, until discovering more of them.

item.title: Atlas Obscura
item.description: Atlas Obscura I discovered as a podcast first, of course, being featured on 99% invisible. Later I found out that the podcast is just part of their service – providing exploration of “the hidden wonders of the world”.

item.title: Craziest Stoppage Time
item.description: One of the news outlets that I follow shared this video of a championship game between Ipswich and Charlton, that was going 2:2 in the regular time, but then it got to 4:4 in the stoppage time of 6 (8) minutes.

item.title: Apple Watch
item.description: A while ago, I had a Withings Steel HR, but I started to hate it because of the pressure to track statistics.

item.title: Pink Panther
item.description: When I was little, I liked watching Pink Panther. I got a bit nostalgic this week when I saw it recommended to me on YouTube, and with the original episodes too.

item.title: Trains
item.description: After the summer passed and the flights to my city stopped, it was time to find another way of traveling to Sofia, and since I hate buses – train it is.

item.title: Seinfeld Merv Griffin
item.description: This year I’ve been finishing Seinfeld and this week I want to share one of my top favourite episodes – the one with the Merv Griffin Show.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: Obsidian is my note-taking app that I plan to use as a personal wiki, and also a bit more like a second brain.

item.title: Cautionary Tales
item.description: Cautionary Tales is another podcast that I found out after an episode of it was shared on 99% Invisible. I instantly loved the idea.

item.title: Calorie Counting
item.description: I’ve never counted calories, well, I tried just once for a minute, but it sounded impossible to be able to track everything, so I just gave up straight away.

item.title: Song Exploder
item.description: I learned about Song Exploder on 99% Invisible. If you love music – this one is big. It’s a podcast where bands and artists talk about how they made a song of their choosing.

item.title: Beard Meats Food
item.description: This week’s thing is another great YouTube channel. It’s about a man with a huge beard, doing food challenges around the world, akin to competitive eating.

item.title: Snarky Puppy We Like It Here
item.description: I didn’t know Snarky Puppy before seeing them mentioned in a video with Larnell Lewis and a note how he learned a bunch of songs on the flight to the live studio.

item.title: Crew Dragon Docking Speech
item.description: I’ve kept this for some years, and because this week has been a bit slow, maybe it’s time to share it as a thing of the week.

item.title: Arctic Monkeys in Burgas
item.description: There was a time when August in my city was crazy. We had a music festival, and it was one of the biggest events on the country’s calendar, especially in the summer.

item.title: Carbot Animations
item.description: The thing of this week is another great YouTube channel. It’s Carbot Animations. They produce very creative and funny animated videos of various games.

item.title: My Skating Playlist
item.description: I have more than 150 Spotify playlists. I love making them so much, that not only I have one for almost every occasion, but often I have more than one because with time I find new music that might fit better.

item.title: Episodes in a Confined Setting
item.description: There is a type of TV show episodes that I like very much – the ones when the characters are in a confined space for the entirety of the episode.

item.title: Jump Rope
item.description: About a year ago, I was searching for a workout that works the abs, and is also interesting to do. I don’t like planks and all the basic ab workouts that are actually effective, but tedious to do.

item.title: Rowing on Lofi
item.description: I’ve been rowing on the indoor concept2 rower for a few years, with some extensive breaks. In the recent months I’ve started working out again, and I have a new favourite background music for doing so.

item.title: MF Doom LoFi
item.description: I’m a big fan of the hip-hop lo-fi remixes, but this week I got a surprise recommendation from YouTube – a lo-fi remix of MF Doom’s work.

item.title: 99% Percent Invisible
item.description: I heard about this podcast on a Vox video I think, they had some kind of collaboration, and it sounded cool, so I just added it to Pocketcasts, for the far future when ideally I would’ve had the time.

item.title: Electric Scooters
item.description: I had a bit of a busy week, so instead of something meaningful, I’ll just embed my video of riding a Lime scooter in Frankfurt.

item.title: Mentour Pilot Videos
item.description: From speaking with other people too, I can say that these weeks there is a channel on YouTube that is recommended to many people.

item.title: Rewatching Fringe
item.description: Historically, Fringe is one of my favourite TV shows. So, the minute I noticed that it was added to HBO Max – I checked out a few of my favourite episodes, which grew into quickly (with skips) rewatching the whole series in 2 weeks.

item.title: Vince Staples New Album
item.description: As I start to bike more for lunch because of the nice weather, I also look up for albums to play with that.

item.title: Biking for Lunch
item.description: The spring is slowly giving up to the summer, and my favourite thing right now is going out to bike to some place and grab lunch from it.

item.title: Music in South Park
item.description: I’m a big fan of South Park, as many other people are. But I always start smiling with excitement when I see that a song is about to be introduced to an episode.

item.title: DeluxeMusicHD Lounge Night
item.description: One night in a hotel room while I was in Berlin, I found out about the best idea for a night tv show – one that helps you fall asleep.

item.title: Russian Doll
item.description: I’ve been behind on my queue of TV shows, but I’m shooting things from my list from time to time.

item.title: Frequent Flights in Spring
item.description: This week I’m celebrating that another company started flying between Burgas and Sofia, and not only in the summer. Which was great news because I’m done using buses.

item.title: Elden Ring Godskin Apostles Music
item.description: I’ve already written how much I love Elden Ring, but the Godskin Apostles music piece deserves a praise on its own.

item.title: New Longboard
item.description: This week, I’m retiring my first longboard, that has been serving me diligently for more than a year and a half.

item.title: r/place
item.description: So, r/place is back again. It’s maybe the best, if not one of the best April Fools’ Day events. The first one was 4 years ago, and the idea was that on this one reddit, you’ll be shown a massive canvas, where you can place 1 pixel of some colour, wherever you choose.

item.title: Dirtiest Trombone Solo
item.description: Another great YouTube recommendation. I’ve been listening jazz from time to time, but I’m not really deep into it. This week I got recommended the “dirtiest trombone solo”.

item.title: Standing on a Comet
item.description: Some day, I need to compile a list of my favourite videos that I sometime use to ease myself into sleep.

item.title: Elden Ring
item.description: It’s hard to start describing this game. It’s grand, it’s massive. It’s absorbing. It’s the best open-world game right now.

item.title: Warcraft Orchestra
item.description: As someone who grew up playing all Warcraft related games, the world and the story are highly emotional and nostalgic for me.
I don’t feel like doing it this week.

item.title: Dark Souls 3
item.description: After finishing Dark Souls 2, understandably I was on another indefinite break from gaming, but when I found out about the Elden Ring release date, I thought that doing Dark Souls 3 before it, will be nice preparation for it.

item.title: Shadow the Jewels
item.description: For some years now, I’ve been listening to a mashup between two of my favourite musicians – DJ Shadow and Run The Jewels.

item.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
item.description: Recently, I rewatched Maniac, and I’ve been in search for films or other TV shows that are in the same category.

item.title: The Normies Channel
item.description: This week’s thing is another YouTube channel. The Normies create reaction and review videos of various TV shows and movies. They are very interesting to watch, and often when I watch something, I check if they’ve made a watch reaction to it.

item.title: Back to Todoist
item.description: Quick follow-up to the previous to-do app thing of the week. That I’m now back to Todoist, and maybe considering using it seriously for a first time.

item.title: Chess
item.description: Unsurprisingly, I got into chess after watching Queen’s Gambit. Well, I started playing a week before watching the TV show, but it was in preparation for the show, so I can say that it was because of it.

item.title: Queen's Gambit
item.description: I had Queen’s Gambit on my watch list for a while. I was pleasantly surprised that a TV show about chess is getting appraisals, so I thought I better add it for some free weekend in the future.

item.title: Years and Years TV Show
item.description: I don’t know how to explain Years and Years. I’d say it’s lightweight Black Mirror as a base, but it’s also pretty different in some ways.

item.title: Philips Hue
item.description: I’ve been wanting to have colourful lights for quite some time. As a lo-fi enjoyer, having your home in neon blue light is a must.

item.title: Travel Alone Idea on Youtube
item.description: I got a nice recommendation a while ago, I think it was because of my few searches on Japan. It was a channel showing some cool ways of traveling alone through the country.

item.title: KillaKayTV's Youtube Channel
item.description: Watching comedy on YouTube is one of my guilty pleasures. So, here comes another favourite of mine - KillaKayTV. His sketches are one of the most original I’ve seen, because of his ability to portray every role in life – Mother, Salesmen, Barber, Walmart worker, Teacher, the list goes on.

item.title: Dark Souls 2 No Hit
item.description: A tradition to have when you finish a souls game, is to check the funny PVP videos, the speed run record, and the no hit run videos.

item.title: Tenet
item.description: I watched Tenet a bit late, as it always happens with films, but it’s better late than never, right? The movie is great.

item.title: Dark Souls 2
item.description: After I finished Dark Souls, it was only a matter of time until I played the second one. I actually didn’t play it right away because, unsurprisingly, I wanted to take a break from Dark Souls.

item.title: Mechanical Keyboards
item.description: External keyboards are something I never really cared about. I used laptop keyboards for as long as I can remember.

item.title: Rdcworld1 Skits on Youtube
item.description: I’m a big enjoyer of skits on YouTube, and this week I highly recommend checking out RDCworld1 channel. They are very creative and some of my favourite videos on YouTube come from them.

item.title: Maniac
item.description: Maniac was actually recommended to me, which is a very good thing because I would’ve probably missed it. It’s part of my top 5 favourite shows in the last few years, but it’s hard to describe what is it about.

item.title: What Are You Listening to Videos
item.description: As a big music fan, I’ve always wondered what people outside or in public transport are listening. Many times, judging them from outside, it’s not what you expected.

item.title: Xiamoanyc Videos
item.description: I’m not big on speaking many languages, although always very respectful to do before visiting another country, but I always check the Xiaomanyc videos that YouTube recommends me.

item.title: Seinfeld
item.description: I’ve only been hearing about Seinfeld, since it didn’t reach massive popularity in Bulgaria that it had in other places.

item.title: Squid Game
item.description: I’m always a bit behind on the widely popular TV shows, so I’m probably late to the party, but this week I binged Squid Game.

item.title: Diablo 2 Resurrected
item.description: I’m big on nostalgia, so the closer we got to the release, I couldn’t wait to relive my childhood of playing Diablo 2: LoD almost non-stop.

item.title: Let's Encrypt
item.description: I think that the invention of Let’s Encrypt is underrated. I don’t have numbers, but I can guess that it amounted to an increase in knowledge sharing on the web because of its free, easy to use certificates.

item.title: Back to Things 3
item.description: I’ve been a bit lazy on productivity outside work lately. I haven’t been using my Habitica board in months. Maybe one of the reasons, is the pressure that comes off with how Habitica is set.

item.title: Radio Mirror Park
item.description: Lately, I’ve been a daily listener of Another GTA 5 radio. I prefer to listen to this one around sunset, it has the perfect selection of songs for the end of the workday.

item.title: Office Ladies podcast animated
item.description: I am huge fan of The Office. Though I haven’t started to listen the Office Ladies podcast, I love the animated videos they’ve published on YouTube.

item.title: Dark Souls
item.description: At this point, there is not much more to say about Dark Souls that is not already said. A genre defining game that is interesting, very challenging, very punishing, greatly satisfying after your first 100 deaths, and a world building that compliments the story in a perfect way.

item.title: Blade Runner 8 hours
item.description: This one combines two favourite things of mine. Futurism and listening to music before sleep. There are times that I listen to music in bed to get myself to fall asleep easier.

item.title: 3D Printed Simpsons Tv
item.description: I saw the coolest thing on reddit this week. A small 3D printed TV that plays The Simpsons episodes at random, without internet.

item.title: Olympics
item.description: Somehow I wasn’t that much hyped about the Olympics. Usually I watch at least some part of it, but for the first half of it, I only took slight interest in rowing, which sadly was never properly aired on TV.

item.title: Flash FM
item.description: Another GTA radio is my thing of the week. This one, as someone can probably guess by the amount of disco, is from GTA Vice City.

item.title: Classic WWE Videos
item.description: This weekend, I spent more hours that I’m comfortable to share, watching 90s-00s WWE (mostly superstar returns) videos. This blast of nostalgia I mostly blame on finding this 90s WWE Twitter account.

item.title: YNAB Budgeting
item.description: During the years I’ve been trying various apps for tracking expenses and they all worked fine. They did as advertised.

item.title: Lo Fi Biggie
item.description: There’s rarely any video that encompasses that amount of things I like — games, hip-hop, lo-fi, and a hint of nostalgia.

item.title: Hip Hop Superstars on Arsenio Hall Show
item.description: Not much to say about this video. Just a nice piece of history showcasing some the best hip-hop artists ever, together on one scene.

item.title: Radio Los Santos
item.description: Not the first time I’ll praise a GTA radio, and probably not the last. I played GTA 5 a bit this summer (just to finish the story) and maybe the most important thing to come out of that is the discovery of Radio Los Santos.

item.title: History of Earth Channel
item.description: There’s a whole corner in YouTube full of nicely done indie documentaries. One such finding is the History of the Earth channel.

item.title: Bicycling
item.description: After more than 20 years of now owning a bike, I finally felt the need to buy myself one. I use it mainly for cycling with friends, but I can attest that it’s also a good workout replacement if I skip my rowing for some reason.

item.title: South Park Vaccination Special
item.description: TV shows and movies can best represent the times they’ve made in, so it’s always interesting to watch episodes that satirise or give a funny twist to a real life events.

item.title: No Mans Sky
item.description: After a year after I wrote about Internet Historian: Engoodening of No Mans Sky. I finally have some play time in it.

item.title: Vaccines
item.description: It’s here, the most awaited scientific product recently - the COVID vaccine. I got my first shot recently and I’m kind of hyped about the opportunities that it will open for me.

item.title: All Gas No Brakes
item.description: One of my favourite channels on YouTube. It’s hard to explain, so I guess a good starting point is this video although some may prefer jumping straight into some of their best work.

item.title: Synthwave Videos
item.description: I have listened to some synthwave videos on YouTube, but I have newfound love for them because they mix perfectly in my early morning routine.

item.title: Owning Game Console
item.description: I have never had a good gaming PC. I always had a normal computer, just enough to run a relatively old game without annoying me, in most of the cases - just enough to play World of Warcraft without major issues.

item.title: New Parliament
item.description: Maybe a followup to Elections. The new parliament swore, and I’m continuing to very much enjoy our “political crisis” as some are over dramatising.

item.title: Elections
item.description: I’ve written on a couple of occasions about the current political situation in Bulgaria. The whole summer I couldn’t wait for new elections to come, and I definitely didn’t expect them to be on their regular date.

item.title: Science Memes
item.description: I have a new favourite twitter profile. It’s an account named A meme page to check every time MatLab crashes and all they do is share science related memes.

item.title: Japanese Breakfast New Single
item.description: I have a soft spot for catchy basslines. That’s why I got addicted to Be Sweet by Japanese Breakfast the moment I heard it (thank you Pitchfork).

item.title: Skating in the Sun
item.description: Maybe the best thing about having an longboard, is the freedom it gives you while roaming around, and that is especially true when you are doing it on a sunny afternoon close to the sea.

item.title: Conan Remotes
item.description: I won’t get into much details on this. I don’t watch late night shows, but I binge watched most of the Conan remotes on YouTube in the span of 3 days.

item.title: Learning a New Programming Language
item.description: For those that do it often (1-2 years), there are few things more enjoyable for a software engineer, than learning a new programming language.

item.title: NF
item.description: I’m a little late to the NF party, some of my friends were talking about him two years ago, but sometimes I don’t believe the hype.

item.title: FTL Faster Than Light
item.description: This game has a special place in my heart: - It was my way to cope with the first 2020 lockdown.

item.title: Algorithmic Code Challenges
item.description: Some people hate the so-called algorithmic code challenges, probably because of their overuse in interviews, but to be fair - I love like them.

item.title: Justina Valentine Freestyle
item.description: This one is for the hip-hop fans that can appreciate a good freestyle. It’s not only the first woman to do the five fingers of death, but she did it on top of her head with very hard beats.

item.title: Failing on Important Interview
item.description: I am writing this many weeks later after the events transpired, so this “thingy” would lose its emotional parts, but this may be for good.

item.title: Illusions of Time
item.description: Nostalgia would be a prevalent topic in these journal-like series, so this great video by Vsauce is unsurprisingly the thing of the week.

item.title: Anki Flashcards
item.description: I found out about Anki in a very nice article called How to Make Yourself Into a Learning Machine Although I am yet to try the many good practices mentioned in the post, I did try using Anki flashcards during my interview prep.

item.title: Not Just Bikes
item.description: The first video I watched from Not Just Bikes was sent to me by a friend with a high interest in city planning.

item.title: Darkest Dungeon
item.description: Darkest Dungeon is an indie game I bought on a cyber Monday discount, after seeing in a couple of streams and reading how unforgiving it is (I’m an FTL veteran, I like such games).

item.title: Honeypot Documentaries
item.description: I love watching videos about open source engineers and their projects. Often I will have one of these days where it’s plain hard to motivate myself to work on my projects, or some chore (especially if it’s not that interesting and it feels more like a boring chore).

item.title: Walking at Night Videos
item.description: I’ve watched many of the binaural city walk around city X videos, but it wasn’t until this year’s pandemic that made me fully appreciate them.

item.title: Bear
item.description: I remember Bear was getting popular at the time that Evernote had its first massive pushback. Someone at Evernote decided that people want more AI in their notes, which unsurprisingly turned out to be wrong and drove some people out of their platform.

item.title: How to With John Wilson
item.description: I’m behind on most of the tv shows I followed before 2020. I don’t have the time and the will to focus on one at the moment.

item.title: Stopped Using Facebook
item.description: I was clearing some links from the hundreds of articles that I have marked as “To Read”. And Somewhere at the end of the marathon, I stumbled upon Facebook’s problems can be solved with design.

item.title: Skating in the Night During a Pandemic
item.description: I’ve been having pretty much the same night routine in the last 3 months — going out to skate with my longboard while listening to a podcast or an album (Beach House, mostly).

item.title: Minecraft Atmospheric Videos
item.description: I’ve mentioned multiple times that I have problems finding what to listen to while working. Here’s my new addition to the topic — 10 hour Minecraft ambience videos.

item.title: Beach House - Bloom
item.description: I discovered this album almost randomly on Twitter(of all places) around the time it was released about 8 years ago.

item.title: Waking Up Early
item.description: Getting up from the bed at the earliest hour possible is the pivot of all self-care articles ever written by the self-proclaimed life/productivity hackers on medium.

item.title: Inter Typeface
item.description: A few years I back I loved to check what font people used for their site, I even had browser extension for this purpose, it could tell me the font just by pointing to the text I was interested in.

item.title: Brain Fm
item.description: Surprise surprise! Another week, another productivity thingy. I’ve probably read about brain.fm in Engadget because I remember trying it at work for a while, without being that much impressed, although every time I listen to this wonderful track they’ve put for free on YouTube, I think about checking it again.

item.title: Forest
item.description: Here we go, another productivity app. This week’s thing is an app called Forest, which as kind of popular and I’m late to the party but I just found out how it can help me.

item.title: Notebooks
item.description: I was a strong opponent to writing on paper, I’ve tried a plethora of to-do apps, used an erasable “smart notebook”, bought a touch screen pen, there was even a time that I was worried that I won’t be able to fill legal documents right (that bad) but it wasn’t until I decided to buy myself a Fountain Pen as a gift (inspired from a subreddit about fountain pens) that I turned my mind around paper.

item.title: The Changelog Podcast
item.description: Usually I don’t have time for podcasts, it’s not that I can’t find interesting ones, I just don’t have the habit of investing time in them I guess.

item.title: Codewars
item.description: Around 7 years ago when I was already deep down in the jungle of becoming a self-taught software engineer, I don’t remember how, but I’ve stumbled on checkio.

item.title: Taking a Time Off
item.description: Illustration by Vijay Verma Over the last few years, I’ve always been taking days off work for specific reasons, mostly traveling and concerts.

item.title: Longboards
item.description: It took me a few summers to decide, but I’ve finally bought myself a longboard 😲 Aside from turning my legs into jelly the next day and making my other workouts harder, it’s a great way to cruise around and hype to a hip-hop bangers.

item.title: Fall Guys
item.description: Let’s see if I’m able to explain this game. It’s a battle-royal kind of game where you start with 59 other players and try to get to the finish line or not get knocked out of a platform.

item.title: Illustrations for Everyone
item.description: Illustration by Susana Ortiz Time has finally come for the second “thing of the week” about tooling.

item.title: GTA Vice City Radios
item.description: A nostalgic one. I actually don’t remember what reminded me to search videos about Vice City, but for sure I’m thankful I did.

item.title: Having a Cheat/Reward Days
item.description: Illustration by Elsma Ramirez I’ve been working out three times a week for more 10 months now, but it wasn’t until I moved to a stricter diet and daily workouts, that I found out how fun and important cheat reward days can be.

item.title: Six Problems With Our School System
item.description: This is a video I’ve been keeping for a long time because as a someone who rarely had any interest in school besides sports, it speaks deeply to me.

item.title: Protests
item.description: Here’s the main reason that I was late on so many things in the late summer. After a long chain of events, a massive protests erupted in Bulgaria, and for those who are far away from Eastern Europe - this is a huge deal.

item.title: World of Warcraft
item.description: Here we go, the game you now hate while playing, but love while not. The main source of nostalgia for millions of people, and one of the reasons I skipped writing a couple of posts here, because I was busy levelling and gearing my new Death Knight.

item.title: Typewriter Businesses
item.description: I have a soft spot for people who try to preserve forgotten technology and old ways of doing things, so this post is about typewriter businesses, and I’m not talking about antic stores, I’m talking about legit typewriter selling and repairing places with 5 star reviews.

item.title: Every Frame a Painting
item.description: Most of the times on YouTube you spot pretty quick if the content is thoroughly researched and tailored to the last detail.

item.title: The Underground Hip Hop Mixes
item.description: This week I want to drop a huge thanks to the people who create the underground Hip-hop mixes on YouTube.

item.title: Zach & the off Camera show
item.description: I have seen a couple of videos from the off camera show a while ago while searching around YouTube (that black & white is something you never forget), but never actually decided to check other interviews from it.

item.title: Internet Historian: Engoodening of No Mans Sky
item.description: I haven’t played No Man’s Sky yet, mainly because I don’t have where, but if you are following game news at least at the basic level - you probably have heard of the hype around the release of No Man’s Sky, the harsh criticism that it didn’t live up to its promised gameplay, and then its near heroic return, with a couple of really successful patches.

item.title: Habitica
item.description: This week’s issue is about the thing that made the most impact on my productivity in the last year.

item.title: Tmuxinator
item.description: Here we go, issue 1. I will probably sound like one of these cheesy TV shop commercials that want you to call in the next 5 minutes for a great deal, but hear me out.
